comments:
I noticed that the System container is displayed in the PCX (Project Container Explorer) so I tried to open it, (right click | Open project container )

I see a Class cast exception I guess we are always assuming we are opening a ProjectContextContainer and the System container is really opening a ContextContainer.

ProjectContainerManager extends ContainerManager.  It exposes the listContainerUris() method without doing any filtering of container types.  The result is all containers, both Project and non-Project, are returned.

The ContainerManager retrieves a list of context containers from the property files located at CORONA_CONFIG_HOME.  It will open each property file and get the URI for each ContextContainer.  

Unfortunately, the container type is not defined within each property file.

Several options for fix are:
1) Update container property file to contain container type.
3) ContainerManager open each ContextContainer and check its type
3) Have ContainerManager obtain the list of contains from SystemContainer.

Implemented SystemContainer as the manager of the list of ContextContainers.  Each ContextContainer is defined as a RepositoryDescriptor within the SystemContainer.

Provided convenience method, ContextContainer.listContainerUrisByType(), to get the list of contains for a specific type.  Thus allowing PCX to get the list of only ProjectContainers.
